spit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to force a small amount of saliva (=the liquid in your mouth) out of your mouth
spit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Nick rolled down his window and spat.
A group of fans spat on the players as they left the field.
spit.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to force something out of your mouth
spit.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Billy stood up slowly, rubbed his jaw, and spat blood.
Diana tasted her martini and quickly spat it out.
spit.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to say something quickly in a very angry way
spit.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to send out small bits of something, for example fire or hot oil, into the air
spit.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: A log fire was crackling and spitting in the hearth.
spit.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if a cat spits, it makes short angry sounds
spit.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth
spit.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a long thin stick that you put through meat so that you can turn it when cooking it over a fire
spit.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a long narrow piece of land that sticks out into the sea, into a river etc
